intro: Palicourea madidiensis, commonly known as the Madidi palicourea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly in the Amazon basin. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, which are typically elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, usually with white or pale pink petals. While not widely studied, it is believed to have potential pharmacological properties due to the presence of various alkaloids.
